application_instruction: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Mountain View, CA, USA; San Francisco, CA, USA; Boulder, CO, USA
description:
At Google, we don't shy away from big, crazy ideas--and that's not just in our products. We aim to foster the healthiest workforce on the planet and our Benefits team is behind the wheel, driving these efforts. From retirement planning to financial literacy courses to healthy living campaigns, our Benefits team runs programs that are designed to keep our global Googlers healthy and happy. With more than 60 offices across the world, you're able to swiftly maneuver through the complexity of serving different legal and cultural practices, while also finding creative opportunities for giving our Googlers equitable support. You'll build an understanding of what "wellness' truly means to each Googler, and implement innovative programs as the population of Googlers grows in size and diversity. You are a mission-driven, enthusiastic team player with the creativity to develop and manage benefits programs.

As a manager, you support team members to exercise independent thinking and make rapid progress towards goals. Working closely with your team to deliver results, you remove roadblocks and ensure that projects and tasks are appropriately resourced.

As a Disability Accommodation Manager, you’ll manage a central accommodation team, define operational workflow and handle direct case management of Googlers. Your team is accountable for all workplace disability accommodations for Googlers and candidates with disabilities, including managing vendor relationships. You’ll partner closely across our PeopleOps team to deliver training, secure resources and establish best practice administration. In addition, you’ll provide oversight and administration of the Americans with Disabilities Act provisions, evaluations and accommodations.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources"). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the advocates of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 6 years of experience working in disability accommodations, organizational processes and procedures in a corporate setting.
  • 5 years of experience in people management.
  • Experience working with applicable state and federal disability laws and regulations (i.e., Americans with Disabilities Amendments Act (ADAAA), Fair Employment and Housing Act (FEHA), Family Medical Leave Act (FMLA)).

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree in Counseling, Rehabilitation Counseling, Clinical Psychology Social Work or similar job-related field.
  • Experience in establishing relationships and working collaboratively across multiple offices, geographies and worldwide time zones often via email and video.
  • Ability to assess downstream impact of decisions across the team, implement team goals/objectives across the organization and effectively manage details.
  • Ability to apply sound judgment in ambiguous situations and effectively use resources/expertise/leadership across the team to inform decision making and strategic thinking. Ability to work in a fast paced, rapidly changing environment.
  • Exceptional analytical skills with ability to analyze metrics, research and trends.
responsibilities:
• Manage a central workplace accommodations team and drive the long term strategy. Ensure organization structure and workflow execution are aligned around achieving both compliance and operational excellence across the program.
  • Maintain current working knowledge of ADA, EEOC and FMLA (including other state or federal laws that affect leave) as well as market trends and employer benchmarking.
  • Be responsible for process compliance with legislation and accessibility policies, partner training, employee communications and vendor management to determine gaps and areas for improvement and efficiencies by making recommendations for operational changes, enhancements and other operational improvements as needed.
  • Partner with and support Diversity, Staffing, Health and Safety, Employment Legal and our People Consultants on all things disability accommodations/accessibility related while managing and messaging sensitive and confidential information appropriately.
  • Handle ADA and complex leave escalations working directly with Googlers, managers, HR and Legal to resolve complex situations.
title: Disability Accommodation Manager
